item.title: Federal Lands Jobs and Energy Security Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 254.

item.title: Protecting States' Rights to Promote American Energy Security Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 255.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 222 - 196 (Roll no. 591). (text: CR H7201)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 222 - 196 (Roll no. 591).(text: CR H7201)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 194 (Roll no. 590). (consideration: CR H7209-7210)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 419.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7201-7211)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 75.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1965 and H.R. 2728. The resolution provides for one hour of debate and makes in order only those further amendments printed in the Rules report 113-271. The rule provides one motion to recommit with or without instructions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-271, by Mr. Bishop (UT).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-271, by Mr. Bishop (UT).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1965) to streamline and ensure onshore energy permitting, provide for onshore leasing certainty, and give certainty to oil shale development for American energy security, economic development, and job creation, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2728) to recognize States' authority to regulate oil and gas operations and promote American energy security, development, and job creation.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1965) to streamline and ensure onshore energy permitting, provide for onshore leasing certainty, and give certainty to oil shale development for American energy security, economic development, and job creation, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2728) to recognize States' authority to regulate oil and gas operations and promote American energy security, development, and job creation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
